intro: Clandestina purpurea, commonly known as the purple clandestine, is a rare and striking plant native to the misty highlands of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant purple petals and velvety leaves that shimmer in the dappled light of its forest habitat. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its unique ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Clandestina purpurea is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
